title: geth 1.7.3 keep dropping connection.
body:
#### System information

Geth version: 1.7.3
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour
Through console, ```admin.addPeers("enode://c3134450f60e18f767542ff24be4a2b87331da870d04087e66964a37be84b7fe9d65e853462f84a1f122aaf78ea4ce62413bac05822ac8a39241ecb8dcb68423@10.0.3.4:30010")```
The node should keep a connection to the target.

#### Actual behaviour
It keeps dropping connection for different reasons. (See logs)

1. Drops connection because of ```err=EOF```, onle keeps 3.622s.
```
2017-12-20T02:47:47.110689177Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:47] Ethereum message handling failed         id=c3134450f60e18f7 conn=inbound    err=EOF
2017-12-20T02:47:47.110758576Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:47] Removing Ethereum peer                   peer=c3134450f60e18f7
2017-12-20T02:47:47.110845476Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:47] Light Ethereum message handling failed   id=c3134450f60e18f7 conn=inbound    err=EOF
2017-12-20T02:47:47.110869975Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:47] Removing p2p peer                        id=c3134450f60e18f7 conn=inbound    duration=3.622s             peers=0 req=true  err="disconnect requested"
```

2. Drops connection because of ```err="Unexpected response - "``` and ```err=EOF```
```
2017-12-20T02:47:53.002812052Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:53] Queued propagated block                  peer=c3134450f60e18f7 number=63 hash=d96ee0â€¦798ecb queued=1
2017-12-20T02:47:53.004487541Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:53] Light Ethereum message handling failed   id=c3134450f60e18f7 conn=staticdial err="Unexpected response - "
2017-12-20T02:47:53.005025438Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:53] Ethereum message handling failed         id=c3134450f60e18f7 conn=staticdial err=EOF
2017-12-20T02:47:53.005043738Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:53] Removing Ethereum peer                   peer=c3134450f60e18f7
2017-12-20T02:47:53.005170537Z DEBUG[12-20|02:47:53] Removing p2p peer                        id=c3134450f60e18f7 conn=staticdial duration=4.016s             peers=2 req=false err="useless peer"
```
#### Steps to reproduce the behavior
1. create a genesis.json for the private network.
2. setup bootnode.
3. setup several nodes start with the `--bootnodes`
4. connect to one node console, addPeers.

I believe it's not 100% reproducible, but it tried over 10 times recently, it failed around 9 times. The static-nodes.json settings are similar. Sometimes it works, but most times it doesn't work.

#### Logs

Update: The private network I was setting is enabled v5 discovery on all nodes. 
But If I disable v5 discovery on most nodes, just keep one running v5 discovery, it seems much stable. Although peer didn't find each other through bootnode, at least they can keep the connection to bootnode.


Seems the bootnode shouldn't  run both (v4 and v5) discovery protocol?
